title: Home
text: I am a motivated Applied Computing (FinTech) year 1 student at Singapore Institute of Technology. I have hands-on experience in programming, problem-solving, and collaborative project work. A results-driven and detail-oriented individual, I thrive on learning, perseverance, and contributing to team-driven innovation. I enjoy exchanging ideas, sparking creativity, and developing effective solutions to complex problems. Open to exploring diverse roles in business and financial technology to further expand my knowledge, skills and experience.

title: My FYP Project
text: My FYP project was a 6 months internship at Synapxe Pte Ltd, formerly known as Integrated Health Information System (IHiS). Synapxe is a healthcare technology company that provides digital solutions to improve healthcare delivery in Singapore.

title: My FYP Project
text:
Intern Responsibility


Worked in a team supporting the Next Generation Electronic Medical Records (NGEMR) Go-Live Project at Tan Tock Seng Hospital and >10 affiliated healthcare clinics across Singapore.
Provided on-site end-user support for healthcare staff across hospitals and clinics.
Conducted application testing and troubleshooting on end-user devices.
Assisted many nurses and doctors in adapting to the new NGEMR system.

title: My FYP Project
text: My FYP project was a 6 months internship at Synapxe Pte Ltd, formerly known as Integrated Health Information System (IHiS). Synapxe is a healthcare technology company that provides digital solutions to improve healthcare delivery in Singapore.

title: Reflection
text:
I used ChatGPT to support this assessment by generating code examples, fixing errors, and refining explanations.
It saved time and clarified concepts quickly. However, outputs require verification and critical thinking.
In future studies and work, GenAI will assist brainstorming, coding, and documentation while I remain responsible for ethical academic use.

title: Data Visualization
text:
About the Project
This project aims to build a rule-driven system for detecting phishing emails. It leverages Python to analyze and evaluate email content using text analysis and logic-based strategies. The project should include a simple user interface for users to analyze their emails. The system will apply various techniques to classify emails as either ham or spam, helping to reinforce programming fundamentals, including string manipulation and problem decomposition.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Problems to be addressed
Phishing remains one of the most widespread cyber threats in Singapore and worldwide. Such emails exploit emotions like fear, urgency, curiosity, and kindness to appear more convincing. Attackers often impersonate celebrities or trusted companies to trick victims into revealing personal information. Many fall for these scams due to the urgency to respond, perceived authority, or a desire to help. According to a Yahoo News report from August 2025 [1], nearly half a billion dollars were lost across about 20,000 scam cases in Singapore during the first half of 2025.

title: Data Visualization
section: The scoring system consists of three parts
text:
The scoring system consists of three parts









Based on our testing, component caps prevent single-factor dominance. Without caps, keyword-rich but legitimate emails would be misclassified.
